text:
Very old diner feel. 

Dependable breakfast items. With basic presentations. 

Their banana but bread is the best thing on the menu. 

They offer a variety omelets and different breakfast dishes. 

I ordered the coned beef hash Benedict- the eggs were fried, not poached. 

The service decent, not amazing but not bad. 

Perfect location next to sun city. Fits the older clientele

It was a quaint little breakfast joint.  Friendly (and honest!) staff, and tasty food.  I was hoping for fresh squeezed OJ but the server was honest and let me know they didn't squeeze their own.  No worries, I'd rather have water than oj from concentrate! :)

I ordered the stuffed french toast with apples, cinnamon and cream cheese.  It sounded delicious, and was mostly, but my advice would have been to serve the french toast slices on their own, with little pots of cream cheese spread, cinnamon apples, butter and syrop for the customer to put on the toast as desired.  The pre-assembled nature of the stuffed toast caused the center to be soggy.  It was tasty, and didn't warrant a complaint, I'd just have preferred a crispier french toast. 

My husband enjoyed his country friend steak, and while they couldn't do poached eggs, the braised eggs were the next best things.  He gobbled it all up.  

A suggestions to the restaurant: perhaps offer a side of greens instead of the potato/hashbrowns/toast/tomato for the customers who are unable to eat or simply reducing the amount of sugar in their diets.  Just a suggestion :)

Thanks for a delicious breakfast!
Waited for over 20 minutes for bacon and eggs. By that time my coffee was cold and the English muffin they served was cold.  Worst thing is it was 1:40 pm and not crowded at all.
I went with my family one morning and it was great! The portions are huge! Good food, good service and low prices!

My husband & I were visiting the area, found this place on Yelp & decided to try it for breakfast. It definitely deserves its high ratings! 
   We went on a Wednesday morning; it was busy but we were greeted at the door & seated immediately. The servers (we had Pat, who was very friendly) and the owner Iggy all worked hard to keep the service quick & accurate. 
   There are over 40 different omelettes on the menu (and other items too) and each is made with 6 eggs! They were huge and the other ingredients were plentiful (neither of us could finish). The breakfast also includes homemade thin potato slices and delicious (and large) pumpkin or banana nut breads. The coffee mugs are even large! The breakfast was so big that we could have shared one. 
   If we lived nearby, this would definitely be a regular breakfast stop!

I don't know why this place has so many great reviews.
My wife & I wanted to go out for breakfast on Sunday. After reading the reviews of this place, we decided to try it.  I ordered a waffle, my wife got bacon & eggs.  Honestly, I have enjoyed the breakfast at McDonald's more than this place. My waffle tasted like bread dough poured in a waffle iron. The eggs (over medium) were still runny, and the bacon was nearly as hard as beef jerky.
When our waitress asked the obligatory; "How was everything?" , we told her how disappointed we were.  The extent of her attempt at customer service was; "Sorry".

Maybe we were unlucky, but I see no reason to pay $17 for bacon, eggs, a waffle, and one glass of milk, if the product is sub-standard, and there is no attempt to please the customer.   I WILL NOT RETURN.
Excellent food and the service is fast! I highly recommend the OH if you enjoy breakfast.... Lots of choices! They have a great lunch menu too.

I am pretty sure I am done with this place. Gave it a second chance because I really want to love this place. Omelette sure was gigantic. After four bites, I was done. Dry eggs, no seasoning... Just plain bland! The only good thing about this place is their fresh squeeze OJ. Not coming back for more :(

Delicious!  We were on the hunt for some omelets and heard from a local friend about their huge selection.  We were excited to find over 40 different omelets!  As a bonus, the owners clearly had some Chicago ties, so we felt right at home.  Service was great and the avocado and tomato in my Green Hornet omelet were super fresh.  I'd definitely recommend checking it out.

I wish I liked this place better. It's walking distance to my house and so I have eaten here several times while my car is in the shop. The food isn't bad, it just isn't amazing. I highly recommend the omelets... which is their specialty. They are generous, fluffy and flavorful. The bean soup is home made and tasty. The burgers are where they fall flat... on the dry side and pedestrian. Service is fine and friendly and I have NEVER had bad service. Their staff is always smiling and welcoming, even when it's busy.... but the food is just ordinary except for what I mentioned above.
Great service, food and a comfortable atmosphere. The omelets are huge, you really get your money's worth.

A little pricey on the surface until your food arrives and it's a large plate full. They're steadily busy so service isn't as fast as I'd like but you have to take into account the crowds. The food is good.
Was good had a great breakfast would return again.. Liked the location was close to home..

Back again 
 Best breakfast in town 
  This place is a must for breakfast 
 Stopped by after the cancer walk
Glad we stumbled upon this gem. Great omelets. Reminds me of our favorite cafe back home.  Fresh ingredients.  Pleasant wait staff.  Worth a return visit.

A very cool little spot, Chicago atmosphere with awesome Canollis!!! The fresh burgers are yummy--we just happen to look for a breakfast spot near there and ended up trying them out. The owner was very sweet and our server, knowledgeable, fun and upbeat.. I like that!

We will be coming back again...and try other dishes on the menu. :)

Anyone going MUST try the fried zucchini it's AMAZING!! Great service and great food!! The servings are huge!! You can not beat the price. We will definitely be returning and recommending it to everyone.

We have been customers for several years.  The restaurant has only improved over the years.  Food is always consistent. Very tasty.  If you are dissatisfied with anything about your food, they quickly work to prepare a new meal for you.  Our picky granddaughter always orders the eggs Benedict and says it is her favorite.  Lunch and dinner are very good too. Servers are professional and friendly as are the owners who are almost always in the restaurant ready greet and even serve you.

Hands down best fried zucchini sticks anywhere.   I literally dream about them.  You may go for an omelet, which you should because there is every possible combination...including the kitchen sink, but I'm also drawn to the potatoes and pumpkin bread.  Weekends can be a bit of a wait...but wait, you won't be sorry...get the zucchini sticks,  whatever time you go.

This place was awesome for some good breakfast and my server Pam was great! It was my first time there and she helped me find something I would enjoy instead of just trying to up sell me on something dumb. she also then took great care of me after that... I will for sure be going to see Pam!

I usually use Yelp to find places to eat. We came here on a whim and winner winner chicken dinner! This place is amazing! Owner Iggy was so nice and accommodating. It's family run which is great. I love that and we need to support our local family business. This will definately be our go to. I see why they have won best of LV for years. Will also have to check out their Italian dinner. I will tell you this....the BEST banana bread I have ever had

Nothing special. Not a great breakfast place and their Italian dinner items are bland. Went twice. Never again. On my second visit we went with another couple that had an Entertainment Book coupon. The staff wouldn't allow us to sit together and use both coupons. (Only one coupon per table, they said, although that wasn't specified on the coupon.) So our friends had to sit at a table next to us and we shouted at each other to have a conversation. Ridiculous.

Plus their highly touted banana bread reeks of artificial banana flavoring, not fresh bananas; and their special potatoes (served instead of standard hash browns) are like thick, hard, and slightly greasy potato chips.

I don't get the couple of enthusiastic reviews here. Perhaps they have a storied past, but for a Vegas newcomer (two months) this isn't even up to a Denny's standard.

I was surprised about how busy this place is, given it was breakfast and on a Sunday, however, it just never looked that busy to me from the outside. We went on around 10 am - the wait was 20 minutes for two people. However, there were two open seats at the counter with no waiting so we sat there. They told me that it was always that busy on weekend mornings. 

I had the St. Paddy's Day Omelet. Per the waitress the omelets were the best thing to get, made with six eggs. It was a little under $11. It was huge and could feed two people. The St. Paddy's Day omelet contained corned beef hash and cheddar cheese.  The omelet itself wasn't that impressive, other than the size, it tasted okay but a true omelet should be fluffy and a little soft in the center. This had more than consistency of a frittata, eggs were overcooked and was more dense than fluffy. 

The I picked the spuds that went with it. I think that they cut potatoes on a mandolin and fried them.  There was no vegetables, such as onion and green pepper like you may expect in a country potato, the slices were inconsistent as to thickness which in turn made them inconsistent as to how they were cooked. Some were really crispy like a potato chip and other thicker slices were undercooked and greasy in the center. 

Also, the entree came with banana bread, this was tasty, not sure if it was homemade or a box mix though. Some place you can easily tell box mix but either I was really hungry or my palette was off that I just wasn't sure.  

There is a 2 for 1 coupon in the entertainment book up to $7.00 off. So for two people with two omelets our total was around $18.00, I also had coffee which was $2.50. 

I debated between the two and three stars, the food was "meh" but the portion size was good and the waitress was very accommodating and nice. Also, she was relatively attentive considering how busy they were and it appeared that they were understaffed. Also, as a side note it took forever to get our food - they warned us they were back up after we ordered.

Not what it used to be. 

I used to come here all the time a few years back, making a weekly trip. We moved away and stopped going unfortunately. We were in the area so I happily reminded my girlfriend of the place and we gave it a try again. 

Portions have shrunk from what they used to be, I get that maybe it's a cost-cutting measure, but it left me a little disappointed after my meal in which the old portions never seemed to have an issue with. 

We were also annoyed with the help, maybe since we're not older, we're rushed out, but our waitress was obviously trying to get us out of there. I used to love this place over the various egg-works chain of places, but sadly I doubt I'll be making a trip out here again.

Our first visit to The Omelet house was good. 
The staff is very engaging and take good care of you. 
I had my normal Ham & cheese omelet and my wife had bacon and eggs. 
We learned a great deal that on our next visit  will make our experience even better. 
The normal size omelet uses 6 eggs!!! I wondered why I had trouble eating it all. 
The 3 egg version is only $1 less so it is a tough call not to get the big one. 
The other thing for our tastes were the house potatoes were not the home fried potatoes we expected. They were thinly sliced they placed In the fryer. 
I much prefer the hash browns. My fault but I'll get them next time. 
This is a good place and now we know more we will be back and enjoy it more.

This place is truly as good as it gets! I strongly recommend for you to bring your family and friends here. The whole staff is amazing, friendly, and on par with what a restaurant should be. Jen out server was not only friendly but quick with all of our needs at the table. Thanks Jen, you rock!

Ok, as for the food - I must say the portions are not only huge but tasty. I opted for the lox omelette and I was not let down. Apparently they use six eggs so make the omelette. I plan to make the far trip and go back there.

I had the lobster Benedict and I liked it. Tasted like real lobster, not shy on the lobster or avocado. my hubby had the Kitchen sink and he liked it. All in all I would be back to this hidden gem. Nice family owned restaurant. We went on a third around 3:30pm and it was good.

My family eats at Omelet House in Summerlin  twice a week the last 4 years. Never had a bad meal or bad service whether breakfast or dinner  All waitresses  & cooks are great especially Lisa & Stacy. Going there is like being with family. Food & company are welcoming & great.

We went out for breakfast on a whim after going to a car show early, and we are glad we did. This is a very friendly, busy, clean place. They have endless options on omelets at an average of $10.79, with toast (or other bread option), and a potato option. Generous portions and attentive wait staff make for a very nice meal out. The pancakes are really good and Giant, so keep that in mind when ordering those. The pumpkin bread is delish too.
So 4 waters, 4 coffees, 4  big omletes w/ breads and spuds, and a short stack to split was $60. We took home 4 boxes and had another meal out of it later. That's kind of like cutting the price in half for us then. Would recommend this establishment for breakfast to anyone.

I don't usually rate this low but the reason why it's even getting a third star is because of service and the family type atmosphere.  My main complaint is that their pancakes are cooked in bacon fat and the taste is obvious.  For a someone who doesn't eat pork, I'm really grossed out.  I think things like this should always be disclosed.  Another issue I have is with their omelette, we ordered two and both came out with so much egg that you barely tasted the fixings.  Aside from that, the coffee was good, the potatoes were good and so wad the service.

Finally visited this place.  We arrived and had a blip with service.  We were told to sit anywhere, so we sat right in the middle.  We waited a full ten minutes with waitress after wait passed us by and wait on the droves of people that came in after us.  We decided to move to the near empty counter and place our orders.  

I ordered the "Health Nut" omelette with the banana bread and the wife ordered the biscuits and gravy egg plate.  My healthy choice was made very well and was tasty after the addition of some spice it was great.  The banana bread was the highlight of the meal though. The wife said hers was okay, but was rather bland tasting.  We are going to give it another try.  

Place was very busy, very clean and bright.  We met the owner "Igs" and another waitress and they were very nice.  He apologized for the earlier blip and thanked us for staying.

This was our first time here and omg it was above  of what we expected . It was really packed and seem like we were going to wait for a while but  we were wrong ,we actually got seated right away. 

Our grandparents loved it too and were so pleased . Service was on top of their game.  We cant wait for  our next date

Service was excellent and we got seated faster than they said the wait was. The seating was a little cramped but it was a busy sunday. The food was okay, not the best biscuits and gravy but the pancakes and hashbrowns were good.

Yuk!!
If you want bad service ask for Denise 
Denise doesn't refill drinks 
Had to hunt her down for a refill
Food was not worth the money 
Ordered a Philly got a beef with chz and grilled onions and peppers 
Was not a philly chz steak!!
Other people at table had beefs. 
It was the same meat!!
Bus girl was sweeping carpet under the tables by us while we were trying to eat 
I said something and she still continued to sweep the carpet 
Vacuuming would make more sense with carpet 
Especially in a restaurant 
They had a vacuum 
I saw it when we were leaving 
Nothing like eating dust and debris in our food 
Don't wast your money here!!! 
Not a clean place to eat 
Not worth the money 
$11.00 for a beef and fries 
What really happens in the kitchen here and backroom 
No health grade sign hanging that I saw 
They even let the lady in that's living behind the dumpster 500' away 
She sat 2 booths away

I ordered the jolly green giant omelet was amazing and fresh.  My husband ordered eggs Benedict and said it was crazy good.  Over all amazing place.  Would come back again!  You must try it.  Very friendly staff as well.
Best breakfast ever in Las Vegas!! Options for everyone ( kids, healthy, not so healthy but yummy) very good service! I wish I knew about this place before!
Great place for breakfast! Family friendly and great service. Yummy hollandaise sauce on my benedict.

I ate here for the first time recently. I had the best banana bread, served warm with a side of butter.... I had an omelet with bacon and avocado and bell peppers. The service was average but the food was great !! I'll be back for sure

One of the worst restaurants in Las Vegas. The wait staff is slow and sometimes downright rude. They post coupons all over town (newspapers, entertainment books, etc) but act completely rude and condescending when you try to use them. The last straw for us was when we tried to use a 2-for-1 coupon at 7pm on a Tuesday. Restaurant was completely empty except for one other table. We were told that we could not use the coupon on breakfast (we both ordered omelets), only on their "Italian Special" dinners. SERIOUSLY?!?!? Never again. Now I only go to Cracked Egg, Egg Works or Egg and I.

This is my first Yelp review. We loved this restaurant so much that I wanted to tell the world. We are New Yorkers who love living in Las Vegas but do miss diners. This was better than anything I miss from home. I loved our server Pam, she made us feel welcome. She was patient and kind with my mom who has Alzheimer's  and the food was really great. It had a nice family atmosphere. I plan on making this a Sunday tradition.
The food was good, not great, but good.  The people that work there are great and upbeat. I'm just not too excited about the seating arrangement.  Also, prices seemed a bit high for what I had BLT.

Love the lobster & shrimp omelet!  Our server was so sweet. This place is the best! 

BTW NEVER go to the Charleston location! Kevin's the rudest person I have ever met!
Great food owners are from Sicily and cook great Italian food for dinner try eggplant it's the real deal not some fried olive garden junk but very good batter no grease

I used to LOVE this place came every weekend. Then I moved and haven't been in a few years. Had a craving for their spuds drove about 20 minutes. The food has gone downhill. Ordered a veggie burger and they must have just Cooked a meat patty on the same spot. Whole veggie patty tasted like charred meat and oil. Not exactly what a vegetarian wants to eat. The spuds weren't soft and fresh like they used to be. Only good thing was the waitress was very nice and helpful. Wish they would have been the same quality like I remembered.

This is the best family friendly family owned and operated breakfast house in town! I have never had bad service at this restaurant. They are always super busy - and the food is always great. They have amazing omelets, but I absolutely love their homemade corned beef hash and eggs! 

The restaurant walls are themed anything and everything Chicago - as the owners are from Chicago. Great food at a great price.
I honestly cannot give this a rating as far as the food goes. My wife and I were in there and waited about  15min to be served no one came to our table they were not even that busy.

The food and service was really good today.   
Plus,  we were seated right away.  
Still the best banana bread around...

One of my favorite breakfast spots. The potato spuds are amazing. Food is always hot and fresh. The only downfall to this place is that the server could have been more attentive. Other than that I recommend everyone to come here because it's delicious.
Food is ok... For the price, I could get the same elsewhere and pay less and not get charge for every EXTRAS... like onions on my chili or extra crackers on the side.. Smh!

At the suggestion of my wife, we decided to try this place for breakfast. We have passed by this establishment many times in the past since we do a lot of shopping at the Smiths next door. The first thing that I noticed was how clean the place was and the atmosphere was like a real family owned eatery. Very pleasant and relaxing. Our server was very friendly. Stacy was the perfect example of what a waitress should be. The food was good with huge portions. My wife says that this place is her new number one for breakfast. I say it is my number two with Hash House A Go Go being number one, but another one in our breakfast party agrees with my wife so that's why I give this place a five star rating. With the German bakery next door this shopping plaza has a lot going for it
The food was delicious I had the California Omelette I highly recommend it! The staff is very nice and attentive will definitely come back.

I recently discovered this location a month ago and am glad that is saves me a drive from the Charleston location I used to frequent.  Even though this location is popular and busy I've always been able to find a seat with minimal wait times.  I was satisfied that it was clean, specials were communicated on the chalk board as soon as you walk in, and everyone is really friendly.

What I really enjoy here is the basic breakfast since it's one of my favorite meals, I got the ham and eggs with toast.  Sure what I choose is a basic breakfast but I loved how it's all freshly made and the ham was cooked well and not overly salty.  I've eaten here with friends who've gotten the "Kitchen Sink Omelet" and various sandwiches and everyone has always left full and with boxes for the leftovers.

If you're up for a clean, friendly, and delicious breakfast/lunch place with friends I'm sure anyone can find something on the menu.  I've already added this to one of my options on weekend mornings.

My wife and son and I tried it for breakfast and it was fantastic.  Food and service were outstanding.  We decided to come back a couple nights later for an Italian dinner.  What a great meal.  We like the Olive Garden but this was much better.  Run by a husband and wife team that are proud of their place and they should be.  We all highly recommend the Omelet House!!

Overall experience was good. The food portion was just right for the price and everything tasted really good! We did lose something in the restaurant though and I called back a couple of times and even went in and the owner of the business was very rude telling me it wasn't there and when I went in to check he wouldn't even look me in the face he looked annoyed that I wanted to check. I get there was customers but he was rude. We ended calling on a Tuesday to re ensure our item wasn't there and this lovely young lady assisted us and turns out our lost item was there.

So Delicious!  Omelet is perfect.  Thankful server recommended smaller omelet.  The potatoes are great.  The pumpkin bread is a wonderful treat, served warm and very moist.  Very friendly staff.  Highly recommend.

This restaurant is a regular stop for my family.  Whether for a great breakfast or an excellent Italian dinner The owners are there almost all the time and make sure the food is prepared properly, efficiently and is always tasty.  Very clean throughout, it is a pleasure to go there and they have recently added beer and wine.  Been going there for over 12 years and have never had a bad experience.  Treat yourself and go there

We looking for a good spot to have breakfast during the week and yelped this spot in Summerlin.....we were impressed.  Clean, fast and delicious.  For them to have been shorthanded on staff they worked together as a great team! Customer service was very warm and welcoming.  Perfect attention didn't need for anything and was not left alone waiting for something. The food was on point,  coffee was hot and fresh and so was the banana nut bread delicious!

Our favorite family breakfast spot. Great food, friendly wait staff and a hands on owner. They are always busy so expect a wait but they are attentive. Iggy the owner and his dad name you feel right at home.

This place is pretty consistent when it comes to quality of the food and service. They are super-busy on Saturdays so expect to wait a bit for both seating and placing your order. Eat the pancakes when they're hot or they get a bit chewy!

I had the breakfast of a rarely seen dish in Las Vegas ;Crabcakes  Benedict:    LOVELY avocado neath it- Hollandaise [my choice] on side---- Terrific server 'DeAun' -think how it's spelled- Her effervescence certainly enhanced my dining-- came w/ potatoes----- worth $14-- really fine offering..

Went to the Omelet House for breakfast yesterday and after being seated (no wait) could not get the attention of anyone to get us coffee or water. Waited a good 15 minutes and never got helped.  When a waiter went to the table next to us to ask if everything was ok he looked at us and walked on.  My wife and I decided to leave and as we were getting up a waitress ran over and said she would help us.  At that point we had already decided to go elsewhere as there are a couple of other good breakfast places in the area which I won't mention in this review so I don't look like I am writing this to put in a plug for somewhere else!  The kicker was that as we passed the front counter the guy who sat us 15 minutes ago never looked up and said " Thanks for Coming"! What made it funny is that no one else was seated after us and he didn't recognize that we had left unserved.  Don't bother going here. People don't seem to matter.
Everything I have ordered from the pumpkin bread to the meatball sub is amazing!  The staff is friendly and knowledgeable and you must order the HUGE iced mocha! So delicious!

They have a great selection of omelets...lots to choose from.  My husband had the chili verde one and I tried the ham and cheese. The omelets were very good and flavorful...full of the meats and pretty good sized. I would have liked them to be a little warmer...the cheese wasn't completely melted but they tasted great nonetheless. I love the "potato chips" they serve instead of the breakfast potatoes you get at every other breakfast spot. I'm really picky about my sourdough toast...don't judge me!  But they nailed it...just the right amount of brown and butter!  (More jelly options would have been nice though) The service was top notch and they have a loyalty rewards program which is nice. We will definitely be returning to this little tucked away gem!

I am very satisfied with the breakfast i recieve from here . I also can't wait to try out their Italian Dinners . They have Breads that you can eat before getting your food . They are outstanding . This place is overall a good place to eat . The service is good , and the food is even better (:

I usually don't give places 5 stars, however this little, out-of-the-way restaurant really deserves it and so much more!
I have gone to the Omelet House on Charleston for breakfast several times and I was shocked to discover this location about 10 minutes from my house.
My wife and I went there this evening, basically for her to check it out and because I wanted Italian food. We were BOTH very happy, her in her discovery, and me in my quest for Italian food. 
We both had Italian dishes. The bean soup I had prior to my entree was VERY good. Both entree's were delicious. The flavor combinations were beyond description, and the pasta was cooked, PERFECTLY!!!
The owners parents were on duty this particular evening. Dee was very personable and pleasant, and Frank was as charming as a person can possibly be. I felt a bit guilty because it felt like my parents were serving me, but it also felt warm and very comfortable for the same reason.
Take some time and seek out this little, out-of-the-way gem.... you won't regret it!!!

For a home style weekend local breakfast joint, this places kills. Great friendly service. Potato slices are interesting and the large whole eggs are a beautiful bright orange color - showing their good quality. Avoid the steak though.
Great breakfast place!  Yummy homemade pumpkin bread and awesome selection on omelette's.  Very generous portions! Can't wait to come back next time I'm in Vegas!

This morning we went to the omelette house. As we walked in we were immediately greeted by an older gentlemen who took us to our table with no wait. Super nice and friendly. Right away we were asked for our beverage order which was awesome. Server was friendly, good food, and a great option for someone who wants to break away from the ordinary breakfast chain. If you like omelettes this is the place for you! Get the banana bread if it's available.

The Omelet House is the perfect place to have breakfast, lunch, or dinner if you are in the Summerlin area. This place is located on Lake Mead and Rampart in the Smith's shopping center. We frequent this place about once every few months. It's a pretty popular spot and can get pretty busy during peak hours. Come hungry, because they give you a lot of food! For example, each omelet is made with 6 eggs! You also get hash browns or spuds, I always get the spuds, (think chips but softer) plus toast or a piece of fresh pumpkin or banana nut bread. The bread is really yummy! I have tried many things on the menu, lunch and dinner, and everything is pretty tasty. A few years ago, this place got a new owner and now they offer dinner with an Italian themed menu. Their hours are Mon-Friday from 7-7 and Sat and Sun from 7-2:30. Now the prices are a bit high for standard breakfast fare, but I suppose since they give you so much food it is justified. 

Mom, boyfriend and I stopped in for brunch on Sunday around 1. It was not very busy at all, so I assume we just missed the rush. We all decided to get an omelet, they have 38 different ones to choose from!  Mom got the Mile High City omelet which has ham, diced onion and green pepper, and she added cheese, but they charge $0.59 for cheese. Why this particular omelet doesn't come with cheese is beyond me, considering a majority of the other items do have cheese. Annoying little upcharges like this make me angry. Anyway my boyfriend had the sicilian omelette which has meatballs, italian sausage, mozzarella, and marina sauce. I decided on the kitchen sink omelette, which has no description on the menu, it just says "For Adventurers" so I had to ask the waitress what comes inside. She said 5 different kinds of meats, a bunch of veggies, marinara sauce and sour cream. This was tasty, but it was watery. They didn't cook the veggies long enough and I guarantee they were from frozen, so that is probably why there was so much water on my plate. Not super appetizing if you ask me. I could only finish about half of my food, and took the rest to go. I probably would not order that again. Anyway if you are in the are and looking for a decent place to eat, I would recommend this place.

Yelp 2015 Review #41

Been going here for the last 5 years and I love it every time. It's the consistency of the food and the fact that it's great food for the price. It's similar to Cheers where, if you're a regular, "everyone knows your name". Stuffed French toast, Popeye Omelet, any club sandwiches! Thanks Iggy. See you soon!

The Omelet House used to be good, but the last two times I've visited, the quality of the food and the service took a major nose dive.

The waitress rushed us through the entire meal even though the place was practically empty. Not only was it rushed, the waitress didn't even pretend to be friendly.

I didn't think a restaurant could screw up toast, but I was wrong. Toast can get pretty nasty when it's burnt and spread with yellow lard (not real butter). The home fries were like eating grease blobs.

Do yourself a favor and pass up the Omelet House. It's not even good in a pinch.

Pretty basic, came in randomly on a sunday so we caught the church crowd, we were able to get one of the last tables and a line had formed just behind us. While entering i said to my girlfriend... i hope they arent just 8 or 10 dollar omeletes. Haha well that was most of their menu, but it was ok, some people need that variety. I only had the country scramble or somethin.
Girlfriend was excited for the pumpkin bread but didnt eat half of it, not sure why.. only thing she liked was the feeling of the place, small, open, blackboard specials. Did not feel Las Vegasy AT ALL, more like a place in the mid west that would be on Diners Drive Ins and Dives.


Def not the best so not much to say. i'd come back if i was in the mood.. maybe... ok i think i need to give this place a 2nd chance now i feel mean !!

Fave place for breakfast when I get too lazy. This place by far, has the best eggs benedict! The potatoes are so good! Homemade potatoes and the best service. Goes hand in hand. The waitress was always attentive, and mind you, I have been here more than a few times. Consistent and wonderful service and food!

So very cute little place. 
We're seated right away and our drink order was taken right away as well.

Due to the many great reviews on Yelp decided to try the St Patrick's Day omelette, it has corned beef and cheese and we had a side of potatoes and toast. It was so delicious. Ordered it with light cheese and well cooked and they delivered it as ordered. 

Staff was very friendly and place was clean. Wouldn't mind returning here to try some of their other menu items.

I have been coming here for about 2 years due to one item on the menu.  The ham and bean soup is INSANE.  The best soup in Vegas hands down.   The rest of the menu is awesome as well but get the SOUP.   Sick.

This is my favorite breakfast spot. There Isn't a place that makes a better omelette.  I love the breakfast spuds too. The coffee is ok. My wife likes the polish sausage omelette and today our kid ordered the stuffed french toast. It was filled with apples and cream cheese. I stole a bite and loved it. The customer service is top notch. I usually go 2x s month. I always receive very prompt service and very nice crew working there makes the visit enjoyable. It does get busy on weekends so you may have a wait. It is worth it.
This place has the best country fried chicken steak. Service is good. Everyone is so friendly. Love coming here!

Despite our wonderful server, I really wasn't impressed with this spot.  Definitely meant more for people who want a standard "blah" diner breakfast.  We ordered the biscuits and gravy, mozzarella sticks with marinara, and a patty melt.  The marinara was probably just some hunt's tomato sauce, but the sticks were really good!  The breading was crisp and the cheese melty (thank goodness, haha).

My eggs were cooked true to order, but the bacon is cooked until crisp.  I really don't understand why a lot of restaurants cook their bacon until it's hard enough to crack a crown, but... whatevs!  The gravy was a little bland, but not gross or grainy like some other places around town.  The biscuit is tiny, but honestly you don't need much more than what's served on the platter!

We were seated pretty quickly and service was speedy and friendly.  I probably won't be back because I'm in a serious long-term relationship with the Cracked Egg.

I searched for a new breakfast place for my boyfriend and I to try and came across this little gem. I've driven by it a few times, but from the outside, it didn't catch my attention enough to want to stop in. Luckily, it popped up on my yelp and had great reviews so I knew it was time to check it out. 
When we walked in, we were greeted and only had to wait a few minutes for a table. It looks like a typical little dinner inside. The staff was nice. They were busy that morning so it took a little time to get our drinks and order, but it wasn't too bad. Since they're known for their omelets, we thought we'd try those. They have many to choose from so it was hard narrowing it down. A lot of them sounded so good. With your omelet, you have a choice of potatoes and a bread. We decided to get the pumpkin bread and banana bread so we could try both. I really liked the pumpkin bread, but I was disappointed in the banana bread which is usually my favorite. It was really dark and tasted burnt. He got the pork chili Verde and I can't remember the name of mine but it had corned beef hash, potatoes and cheddar cheese in it. I also got a side order of hollandaise sauce to put on mine. Definitely get the potatoes over the hash browns. They were delicious. The omelets are huge. I had enough food to eat for breakfast for 2 days. I think it had like 6 eggs in it. Definitely worth checking this place out. My boyfriend said it was the best pork chili Verde he's ever had (aside from his grandma's). We also met the owner. We were trying flag down our waitress to bring me some sauce but couldn't get her attention. He happened to notice and came right over to us and quickly got us what we needed. He's a super nice guy. If you ever gave any problem, ask for him. He'll take care of it quickly.

Wednesday 11:30am, the place is pretty busy understaff I think. the waitress didn't took the order after 20 mins.  the food didn't come out after 35 mins. and we ordered the Flap special which is  2 pancake, 2 bacon and 2 eggs for $ 7.89 per order.  We had high hopes with this place after reading all the good reviews but I had to try it for myself. Unfortunately, the size of the food just by observing for the whole hour from almost everyones table its not the usual DINER portion, its pretty small for the money your paying for. Especially for a kiddie size of Orange Juice  we ordered and charged us $2.49 and don't ask for refill they will charge you twice.
I love the green chili omelet. Great service too.

This happened to be the closest restaurant to where we were staying in Summerlin and it turned out to be very good.  The waitress was pleasant and very helpful and I loved the choices on the menu. I got the egg white special omelette which was really good. I got tomato slices instead of hashbrowns and rye toast on the side. My sister got the egg Special of the day and it was plenty of food.
I love the Omelet House Summerlin! Not as much character as the original but the food is just as good

Awesome place for a quick, delicious breakfast. Service was awesome. Lobster Benny and kitchen sink omelette were both great, and the banana nut bread is so yummy! Has an Italian vibe to it. Very welcoming place.

Have eaten breakfast at this restaurant many times in the past.  Our most recent experience was not a good one.

Used a coupon found in the paper, although that is really not a savings.  The coupon is for buy one, get one $7.00 off, but you must order two beverages and this comes to just about $7.00.  
On this visit, the portions were smaller than usual, my husband's eggs were overcooked, his hash browns were old and dry.  My spuds numbered about four and were way over cooked and not tasty at all.  

There are so many other breakfast spots in the area to choose from.  We will not be back!

Found this place about a month ago, so close to home and the food is fantastic. Gets a lot of people from Sun City but the place itself is great.  Very clean , good atmosphere and the food is great. Not much more to say other than this will be a regular spot for us.
Banana bread was delicious and the Mediterranean omelet with shrimp and lobster inside was amazing.

Wifey brought me here, she was actually looking for this other breakfast spot that had breakfast bagels but it wasnt there anymore. So we decided to check out this restaurant being it was right there and we were hungry. 

You walk in and get that old school diner feel (which I like) with counter and all. We were seated immediately and asked what we would like to drink. Menu is huge! So many options and you can even pick from their lunch menu. I actually intended on ordering the eggs benedict when something caught my eye....LOBSTER BENEDICT!! Holy crap that sounds freaking good. 

So within 15 minutes I had this delicious and awesome looking meal sitting in front of me, I drenched it with tapatio and dug right in. This has got to be the best egg benedict I have ever had. I don't think I would even try anything else on the menu and risk missing out on this the next time I come. They were not stingy with the lobster meat either, you savor every bite. 

With this awesomeness came these potatoes that were similar to chips only soft, they were equally delish, especially mix with the yolk from the eggs benedict. The service was great, she checked up on us quite often and refilled our drinks as needed. The eggs benedict was like $11 so for $3 more try it with lobster, you will not regret it.

Since moving to Las Vegas in July, the Omelet House at Summerlin has yet to disappoint. The food is always fresh and hot, and reminds me of  my youth. The patty melt I had today was the best I've had in decades. There is no place around Vegas to compare it to.

For a fresh meal anytime of the day, head up to Lake Mead and Rampart and pull in the lit and park. Don't worry if you have to walk a few feet. It's worth it.

This place was not very good. I'm happy that I had a coupon (2 for 1), but I won't be coming back. The service was alright, but the food was not tasty... just kind of bland. I didn't get an omelet; I ordered a hamburger. I've had better hamburgers at Jack in the Box. I'm serious. Anyway... Try it for yourself, you may have a different opinion.

this is the best italian beef in las vegas hands down.they fly everything in from chicago.forget anywhere else in vegas ate at them all even places that say chicago it ain't.we both are from chicago and this is the place has the authenic italian beef sandwiches.even ate it at the other omelet houses forget it! far as I know this omelet house the only one that fly's the beef and gonella bread in from chicago.

I felt I needed to update my review of the Omelet House in Summerlin. They still hands down have the best omelettes in Vegas, but they also have a GREAT staff and owners! Pam is my #1 lady, she is wonderful and takes great care of me and my family. I always make sure we sit in her section when she is working! Thank you Pam for always making our day!

I liked this place a lot. Cream cheese and apples stuffed in French Toast?  Need I say more?  With eggs and bacon added on for a total of $9.99.  Wow!  We got in right away on Valentine's Day even though it was packed because it was just the two of us.  The host kept a soccer team of 25 waiting when they showed up without reservations for that large a party in such a small diner, so I thought he was reasonable.  The waitress was lovely and the food came quick.  The coffee and vanilla creamer were delicious as well.  Overall, I will be back especially since it is close by.  Yum yum!

FOR THE MOST CONSISTENT AND GREAT FOOD - TRY THIS RESTAURANT.  I have been going to this restaurant since I moved into Summerlin, and it's now 8 years, and going strong.  The food is always consistently good and the way you want it.  The owner IGGY and his POP are the best.  It is our tradition to go every Sunday, and we still love it as the first time.  Give it a try - you won't be sorry.  Their pumpkin bread is so yummy - and whatever you like, breakfast, lunch or dinner, you won't be sorry.

Absolutely love this place.  They have a good 30 or so different omelets you can choose from.  I have tried many and never been disappointed!  There potatoes are delicious and would come just for those.  Staff is always friendly and attentive.  I always make a point to stop here when we are in town.
Love it here...their banana bread is awesome! Egg Wite omelet is the best! Service is great
Friendly restaurant. I came by myself and they treated me like a regular!  I had the scramble and it was a good size for me. The pumpkin bread was amazing!

Awesome breakfast!  Honey Salt didn't offer breakfast so we came here!  SO GLAD!!!!  Sat at the bar. Killer breakfast. The meal starts with either banana or pumpkin bread. Yes!!!  Had the meat lovers omlet - but small because a regular omlet is made with 6 eggs. The small is just 3.  Get the "spuds" instead of hash browns. Tiffanee was our server. LOVE THIS PLACE!  Go!!!!!!

We have been going to the Omellet House for about 2 years. We have eaten breaksfast, lunch and dinner there. We go 2-3 times a week. We love their food and their family of servers. 
The owners mother and father work the nights, mostly. However, the owners father also does host work on the weekends. It is a family owned and run type of business. If you ever have an issue, you should discuss it with the owner. He will make it right. 
We love frequenting our local neighborhood businesses and keeping our money in the local neighborhood. This was definietely a GREAT find for us.
If you have never been, you should give it a try!!!

Great little breakfast & lunch diner. The service was really really good. Menu is big and choices for everyone. I got lunch and my husband got breakfast. Fast, friendly, and good food. Nice surprise and perfect meal for our long drive home on New Years Eve.

I have enjoyed this restaurant's good food and service on four diffrent occasions, I am happy to say they have not disappointed me. My visits have been over about 8 months so I believe their quality is consistent. They have always been quick to seat me, even though  the place gets busy in the morning on weekends. It is pretty popular. They have a large and varied breakfast menu. And the portions are ample to say the least. They use 6 eggs for the omelets this is the place to go if you want variety. Their kitchen must be huge and well staffed because they have produced each item I have ordered hot, delicious, well plated, and timely. I have yet to be disappointed or dissatisfied with this restaurant.

We love this place. The food is created with quality ingredients, and never disappoints. The Italian beef is out of this world, but so is everything else on the
menu.  We are always greeted with a smile which  is something you don't always
see in Vegas.  The service is the best ever!
This is our new favorite place hands down.

Best omelet in Las Vegas hands down. Do yourself a favor and take a load off at the Omelet House. Decorated with the regalia of the windy city, Chicago, the omelets are made with six, count 'email, six eggs and their accompanied nicely by their homemade spuds. Hold on to the check until I'm nearly done with my meal, please. Thank you for your excellent service and food. Keep those omelets coming!

We arrived with a open attitude. As usual- Yelp had some very negative and some very positive comments. We are new residents to Las Vegas after moving from Seattle. 

The restaurant is located in a strip mall of Summerlin- about 12 miles from the strip. The restaurant is family owned with beautiful pictures of the kids. This is definately not your chain restaurant. 

The service was exceptional with the waitress filling my coke about 4 times. The meal started with a huge slice of homemade pumpkin loaf that was great.

I had the kitchen sink. It was very large and fresh. It was absolutely huge with lots of cheese and very fresh. There were a few strange things like pieces of meatball. I think it had about 5 eggs and I had to bring half home.

My wife had the shrimp omelette. The shrimp was probably frozen but still very tasty. There was a ton of cheese.

We did not like the potato chips- sliced potatoes with skin on. The fries were kinda mediocre. Next time we order the hash browns.

The total bill was $25.00 which was very reasonable for excellent food and great service.

Atmosphere: Community diner with a ton of local people- lots of elderly also. Not too many kids so it was a very quiet and pleasant Sunday breakfast.

Overall: Excellent value and a great community feel- a definite return visit.

Great value. Wonderful service. Very fresh. Definitely coming back.

Kitchen sink really has everything

Friendly environment, comfortable decor, and an amazing menu. I ordered the Sparticus, which was an omelet with asparagus and mushrooms ( amazing concept right). I went with the pancakes instead of the bread. By the end of meal I felt like I was going to explode.

Let me tell you that small stack of pancakes packed a powerful punch. The omelet was cooked to perfection and the potatoes were ok. I would say skip the cheese sauce and get a side of gravy or ranch instead. The ice tea tasted freshly brewed which was nice on a rainy day. 

The server was quick on the draw and never let our cups run dry. The chances of me being on this side of town again for breakfast are about slim to none, but if you find yourself in the same situation give it a shot.

So...I am pretty disappointed. The cheese sauce that I absolutely LOVE for dipping fried Zuchinni in has been changed!! It was a sharp cheddar flavored sauce before. The nice man tried to doctor it with garlic,  but it was a bit overpowering...and upon further review...did not live up to it's former glory. I tried it again when I got home and alas....not even remotely the same. The cheese now is very mild, and kind of like the same bland cheese that you might get on 7-11 nachos. Thank you so much for trying to fix the change, but it doesn't make up for the loss of one of my FAVORITE things at The Omelet House....I have been eating there (the original location) for about 30 years and this was a serious disappointment.

Well, 3rd time is a charm! I stumbled upon this place when I decided to NOT wait for at a minimum of an hour to eat (lets just call them B.C, you know the place that has the red velvet pancakes) then went to try another place, that was no longer in business (Aloha something), then right next door was the Omelet House.

I didn't expect anything of the place since I have never heard of anyone I know that had been at this place. Soon as I got out the car, I was walking up towards the entrance and an old man who walked in with me, asked me right away "how many ?" I replied, "4; 2 kids, 2 adults please" .  He sat us at the booth. I am not sure who he was, but he was older, italian man, after we were seated, he disappeared. (lol maybe he was a ghost)

Anyhow, I was amazed when I saw the MENU. I browsed thru the whole thing and went with the "The Kitchen Sink" which had EVERYTHING you can think of. It had a disclaimer below it "Warning: For Adventurous people only" or something to that effect. Well, so I order the darn thing. It had everything you can think of: zucchini, peppers, sausage, steak, chicken, mushrooms, marinara sauce, ham, broccoli, tomatoes, onions to name the few. 

I LOVE LOVE LOVE their potato SPUDS. Its like fresh potato chips. =)
I loved it so much i ordered an extra side of it (the fat girl in me requested for an extra side) =P

Well I will definitely be going back for the Kitchen Sink omelet. The stuffed french toast i wasn't too thrilled about and neither was I with the breakfast special and the regular french toast.

Great family, friendly restaurant. We came here with my Dad this past weekend to get breakfast, and I chose to get a the California Club. I took the tomatoes and avocados off. Yuck. LOL But the potato spuds little sliced up potatoes, were perfectly cooked, they were delicious. 

My Dad and Boyfriend both got an Omelet which they are known for and it was huge, practically took up the whole plate. 

Would love to go back in next time in town visiting.

Tried this place being well fit with the other omelette houses. I got to say this place tops the staff is super friendly using polite words and quick service. Very clean and my baby loves her chocolate waffle. Will be back again!

Being born and raised in Chicagoland, this place is a nice little slice of home.  The owner is very personable and friendly.  The food is great, I love coming here for breakfast to feast on their huge omelets.  I definitely try to make it here each time I visit Las Vegas.

Really good (read authentic) corned beef hash. Definitely did not come from a can. And the breakfast specials are filling without losing any tastiness.

I haven't braved this place on a weekend. I simply don't l like waiting in line that long for breakfast. But I have gone early on a weekday and had good luck with friendly waitresses and a hearty meal. I'm partial to the specials. I guess I'm more of a smorgasbord A.M. eater. 

The only thing that bugs me is I have no opinion on their coffee. Only because I haven't tried it. Don't know why. I always have an opinion on coffee. Maybe next time...

Family run cafe/ restaurant. 

If you love omelettes this is definitely the place to come try out. 

My favourite is the banana bread. 

Service is tip top and very friendly. 
Definitely worth the venture out here to experience some great food and a pleasant atmosphere.

I really enjoyed my experience here. Went with my stepfather after golfing in Sun City. There is a secret entrance from the Sun City neighborhood in the back directly behind the smiths next door and there is golf cart parking on the side of the restaurant.  The staff was really nice. There were two waitresses that were waiting on us and both had really good personalities. I ordered a bacon cheeseburger and it was really good. The staff seemed to be really friendly with everyone there. I'll definitely go back!

Love this place! Eating in with family or with my girls before the grocery store, and sometimes ordering to go on a lazy Saturday. Typical Ma and Pa feel. These people are friendly like a big Italian family in here. You are greeted and seated immediately, and asked if were helped within the first minute of walking in. I am queen of the kitchen sink omelet here, its filled with literally every vegetable and breakfast meat you can think of! Cheese sour cream, Italian sauce plus more. Portions are huge, 1 order can easily feed 2 to 3. Also comes with hash browns , or potatoes, and a large slice of banana bread that is delicious and moist but hard to get to after eating the omelet. My kids (two girls) love the fluffy pancakes with fresh strawberries and cream or caramelized apple n cream. The owner i believe he is the Son knows everything about menu and omelets , i ask for his suggestions when I'm feeling bold and he loves when you add/ put your own spin on some of the classics. Prices i think are fair for the large portions you get.
Corned beef hash was great!  Real potato chips was a nice twist to breakfast.  Quaint family owned business.
This is a yummy neighborhood breakfast spot has a real neighborhood feel and great staff food is super yummy

Awesome place! Lots of selection for breakfast and huge omelets. Every omelet is also available as egg-white only upon request. My mother ordered the french toast and that was good as well. The decor is a little outdated, but the staff is super friendly, and the food makes for a great experience.

One of the few places in Las Vegas offering quality diner food with an ambiance reminding me of the East Coast. Love the pancakes and waffles, the service, and the price. 

There can be a bit of a wait depending on the time of day, but that's to be expected. Plan accordingly!

Like many of you, I work in customer service and share my experiences with my fellow co-workers. So when I go out, I observe the staff members at these different establishments and I have only rave reviews for the employees at Omlette House.  And because of it, I personally feel that the great service here is reflected in the food.

Fair warning, here's where I get sentimental. It appears that the true regulars here are in their golden years. At the counter sits an elderly gentleman alone, or is he? The waitress asks him, "DID YOU VISIT YOUR WIFE TODAY? DID YOU GET TO FEED HER? And he replies. As they begin their conversation, other staff members start to gather around him and begin to joke and laugh with him. Its good to see the young showing their support for the elderly. This is just one of a few things I observed in my one visit but by far the most memorable. 

Back to the food! The menu includes many fun omelet names and the descriptions make them all sound so good. It took a while for us to decide what we wanted to try first. 

There are many restaurants where the food portions are large. However, larger doesn't always mean better. The omelet portions are large and so very good. I could only finish half of my very delicious Mediterranean omelet that included lobster and shrimp in every bite. I was looking forward to having leftovers for breakfast the following morning. With my order, i chose spuds, thick cut of potato chips. Yum!

My husband really enjoyed The Kitchen Sink omelet,  which was larger than my omelet. It had everything, four types of breakfast meats, typical omlette veggies, including broccoli,  cheeses, sour cream, and marinara sauce.

Although the short stack was fluffy, it wasn't all that great. But that's okay, the omelets made up for it.

Saturday - Monday, they are open from 7 to 2:30. 
Tuesday - Friday, they are also open for dinner.

I have a lot of family and friends that come to visit. This will be a must for breakfast.

Got the eggs benedict...it was good but a little tooooo runny. My boyfriend got French toast special. His was really good! 

The bill came to $29 to give you an idea of pricing. That's for 2 waters, 1 mimosa, French toast special, and eggs benedict. 

Our server (I think Jennifer was her name? Short pixie haircut) was super friendly and attentive. 

This is our second time coming to the restaurant.

I love this place! It's the quintessential breakfast diner. There was a wait when we arrived but waited less than 10 minutes for a table. 

I got the two egg and ham breakfast combo which comes with hashbrowns and toast and let me say that toast was perfect! It was lightly toasted and had just enough butter. So many breakfast places burn their toast to a charred crisp and slather it in butter to try and cover up the burnt taste so having good toast made me love this restaurant even more.

The two servers that worked our table weren't that friendly. I did see other servers at other tables being friendly so you might get lucky. My scrambled eggs were burnt to the point of a yucky brown outside. The bacon is super thin. My wife's omelet was just okay. Everything was bland, except for the waffle. The waffle was okay. No bells and whistles-just a straight up plane waffle. The best thing we had was the banana bread, which was delicious! Overall not worth the $30 breakfast.

For us, this is a good nearby location for a breakfast place. Been here twice and figured I should write a review.

The restaurant is located in a strip mall in Summerlin and share the same area with the Smiths grocery store, Savers and some other small stores and restaurants. 

The restaurant is family owned and the atmosphere is nice and family friendly.

The service was exceptional on both times. I just love their homemade pumpkin and banana nut bread. 

We had stuffed French Toast with blueberry, American Cheddar Cheese Omlette and Chili Verde Omelette. The taste was flavorful and the portions are huge.

When we came here for lunch, I had their homemade chicken noodle soup which was fresh and tasty. Also their BLT sandwich were amazing.

It's a great value with wonderful service.
Great sliders. My friends omelet was so big she took half home. Nice choice of substitutes for fries. Plus, it's a Chicago owner--Cubs, Bears, Black Hawks  every where, even our Golden Knights.

My sister in law and I stopped in for breakfast this morning. She got the Sicilian omelette with meatball, Italian sausage, mozzarella, and marinara. I had the Californian with sausage, avocado, and jack. Both were absolutely fantastic. It was the best breakfast sausage I had had in a long time. The meatballs were really great too. I got a slice of pumpkin nut bread and I thought I made the best choice until I tasted a bit of the banana nut. Amazing! My biggest regret is that I didn't start eating here sooner. I will be back!

Great eats here! Super-sized portions, so if you are a fan of value, you've found your place here.  They know what they're doing on this food, all of it is splendidly cooked, and consistently.  Try the muffins that come with most entrees at breakfast or brunch.  The only issue is waiting for a table occasionally.  And the booths can feel a bit small sometimes.  But the wait staff is usually pleasant and patient.  You will not leave hungry.

My first time here, unfortunately it wasn't for the breakfast, which looks fantastic, but for the dinner, which oddly is Italian.

First thing, the service was superb.  The husband and wife owners worked as a team in front and there was a cook in back.  It felt like you were at the home of a friend and your friend's outgoing parents were there making you laugh and cooking you dinner.

The food that was ordered...
Caesar salad with shrimp and Spaghetti with meatballs.

The salad was your standard Caesar with bland bottled dressing that came with a piece of garlic bread which was the same cigar shaped piece of bread that you get at Olive Garden.  It was close to closing which unfortunately was probably the reason why the bread was stale.  Mark H said the shrimp that was with the salad was tasty, though.

My Spaghetti and meatballs was not so good.  The sauce was very bland and the meatballs lacked flavor.  The saving grace for me was that we had a bowl of grated parmesan at the table so I buried the dish with cheese and hot sauce. :)  My dinner also came with a piece of cigar bread and with a bowl of soup (or you can have salad.)  The soup was a Navy bean which was the best part of the meal.  It was super thick like a stew and had a nice hint of smokey ham hock.  Maybe I should've gotten a big ladle of Navy bean soup poured over my pasta.

This is another spot that's really close to the house I stay at so it's convenient,  I just need to make sure I come here to try the breakfast the next time.

I hate leaving bad reviews, but I feel I must, in this case.  I will absolutely never eat here again. 

I've eaten at this location with my mother several times, as she enjoys talking with the  owner's family, who are from the old country (Italy/Sicily). I've never been terribly impressed with the food, and the spuds/fries are just awful. 

I hadn't been back for over a year, and I was nearby and decided to give the place another chance. Big mistake. I ordered one of the cheeseburgers and went to take a bite when I noticed tiny green flecks in the interior of the bun. I inspected the bun more thoroughly, and saw a larger (about 1/4 inch diameter) patch of light green mold. 

I called my server over and informed her of the problem and that I would not be paying for the meal. She was very apologetic and offered to replace my meal with something else from the menu. My appetite was gone at this point, so I elected to leave. As I was gathering my things, I saw my server showing the manager (one of the managing family) my burger. The manager actually said to my server: "I don't know what that is, but it isn't mold." 

Really? I know what moldy bread looks like when I see it, and I'm sure as heck not going to eat it!! I just hope that the manager didn't take my bill out of the server's check.

We just moved to Vegas and LOVE this place!  Great food, super comfy environment and a great family run business. We have only been in Vegas two weeks but have been to this establishment six times already! Breakfast is awesome, Super good burgers st lunchtime, and a great dinner menu that we are going to try next. If you are in the neighborhood you must try it! You wont regret it!
Very clean and service was exceptional! I will come here often. The only downfall is the parking it's near desert shores so no one there is in a hurry to do anything!

On the plus side, our breakfast was good and spot on.  What really lacked was the customer service from our waitress.  We were not greeted with a smile from her.  She quickly took our orders and honestly didn't seem to want to be at work.  She came to refill our coffee once after coming to check on us and noticed the coffee mug was empty.  I would understand if she was busy, but she only had 1 other table besides us. And to top it off, she dropped off the bill to our table while we were still eating our meals.  I will note the person who brought the food to us (not our waitress)  greeted us with a warm smile.  And the staff closest to the front doors acknowledged us as we left the restaurant. To sum it up, come for the food, but the customer service has room for improvement.

Love this restaurant and the staff! The food is hearty and the staff is always super sweet and accommodating! They bake bread daily abs a slice of heaven comes with your breakfast! I love their pumpkin nut bread, it's out of this world! The portions are very generous, you'll love this place!

Was anxious to try the omelette house. I love omelettes! When I was looking at the long list of omelettes, our server, Pam, suggested "the kitchen sink". I asked what is in it, she replied everything! I was little bit skeptical but since I asked and was feeling adventurous I did it anyway. Boy am I glad I did it! Ridiculous! Can't wait to come back and try the Italian Beef and Vienna hotdog. Didn't realize this was a Chicago eatery. Delicious! And Pam was awesome!
Always fairly priced scrumptious breakfast foods with huge portions. If you want the homey breakfast feel, go here.

Feeling famished and needing a gigantic meal to fill you up. Come and visit Omelet House for a satisfying meal that will leave you feeling like you consumed 2 days worth of food, lol. Actually everything is large in portions and they can make your order half sizes as well. The menu is quite extensive with omelettes being the main feature, which included 40 different variety of omelette and the option of customizing. Each order comes with your choice of starch that includes hash browns, fries or potatoes studs. Plus your selection of bread or homemade banana bread or pumpkin bread.

Our omelette were made just right and was very filling. The hash browns were cooked evenly with a good amount of crisp and soft like texture and they were seasoned to our liking. However, the homemade Pumpkin and Banana Bread was spot on! Moist and soft throughout and it wasn't dried out. It had this nostalgic flavor that reminded me my childhood years when my family would baked fresh bread. Special shoutout to our awesome server, John! :)

2018 Yelp Review #20

Besides Tiffany our waitress being super attentive to all our orders and needs,this spot was very great with presenting options in food, and keeping that hospitality feel to it!! The menu had so so many different plates to chose from. I had the Scrambler! Coffee was on point! Even the buzer Jose was very friendly to my family and I as he consistently kept coming over to pick up our empty plates! First time visiting,and already looking forward to coming back again!

Unpretentious place - family owned . Good breakfast but also a place we like to go for salads and soups for dinner ( although they close a little early - 7pm:((.  Great service !  Try the fried zucchini - good stuff

As other reviewers stated, service is spotty (polite, but mostly absent, which is strange in a place this size).  Food is good: omelets are LARGE - clearly can be split by 2 regular size folks.  Well prepared and full of good stuff.  

Our sides of the banana bread and pumpkin bread were clearly warmed over which was a little embarrassing for the waitress (who danced around the subject)  But the main course, which was the reason for visiting, hit the mark.

Not easy to get in and out of since you pay at the register (paying during our visit turned into a 10 minute ordeal - it happens).  But, as Yelp says, A-OK.

Went to the omelette house this morning I had biscuits and gravy my husband had country fried steak I didn't get enough gravy on my biscuits so I asked for a little extra and when I got the bill there was an extra charge for something I ordered... As a food server that I am if somebody ordered gravy that already had gravy I would never charge them extra!!!! And I will never eat here again!!!!
We have had breakfast and lunch here many times and have always had good service and good food.  We really like the wide variety of omelet selections available...
I went there for breakfast a few times. The service is good and they have a lot of options in their menu.

I came in and put my name on the wait list. She said it would be 20 minutes and it only took about 6. (Excited it didn't take long) 

We sat down and quickly had our drink order taken. Several minutes later our waitress took our food order. We then waited 25 minutes before the waitress came over, looked confused and said "Oh, I didn't bring your food out?" Then went to every other table to check on them. And we waited again.... Another 7 minutes later we got the food and the potatoes were cold and can tell they have been sitting there a while. 
The omelet was "ehhh" not perfect in taste but my boyfriend enjoyed his. 
I didn't eat more than two bites of mine and they ended up taking it off the bill but gave me attitude the whole time. 

The omelets are big so if you end up going to this place you can definitely share. But to be honest.. Your better off staying home and making food yourself. You won't be disrespected and can stay in your pajamas.

16 of us gathered here for a breakfast before some returned to Northern California. Most of the group hiked the day before and this was a chance to get together with some friends who don't hike and enjoy some time together.

Many thanks to the staff for accommodating us.  We all were served in a timely manner and coffee was refilled often and without having to ask.

I had the house special omelette called "My Little Chick-A-Dee" which was an omelette made with chicken breast cubes, broccoli, onions, and cheddar cheese. I had my choice of hash browns or fried potatoes and I opted for the hash browns.  I also got rye toast.  

You can see from my photo that it's a large omelette.  I went here many, many years ago and I remembered how large their portions were.  The omelette was good but it was no match for the great company at breakfast.  

The Omelet House Summerlin is A-OK!

So, where to begin.....
Extensive creative menu, terrific wait staff, fast service and delicious food!  I would like to show pictures of the food but dug right in when it arrived and my picture is all that was left.  By the way, you can have banana bread in lue of toast.  Do that, great banana bread!  Everything was amazing.
Love the food, people and the family friendly atmosphere. Vast menu of Omelets, you're sure to find something you'll like. Pancakes are awsome here too. Thanks for the great service today Pam!

Neighborhood friendly restaurant that serves up some manly portions!

Our neighbor recommended that we come in and try this place out.  The Omelet House is located in the Smiths shopping center and is owned by a Sicilian/Chicago family...so I knew I was in good hands.

Portions are a nice size so bring your appetite.  Plenty of options from omelets...of course to eggs benedict and LOBSTER benedict to the yummiest buttermilk pancakes I've ever had to...lunch and dinner which I will be back to sample too!

Very friendly service!

Pretty good hidden little spot for breakfast in Summerlin.  Really, it is kinda hidden.  If I didn't see the bunch of people coming out of this little place on a Sunday morning I might have never thought to look in this corner of the strip mall!  It's located in the Smith's shopping center off of Rampart and Lake Mead.  

Seems like this Omelet House is owned by a family that is from Chicago, so the decor reflects as much.  I have no problem with that, the home of Michael Jordan and the Chicago Hot Dog (one of my fav sinful snacks) are OK with me.  It was super busy on a Sunday morning, good mix of locals and what seemed to be a bunch of church goers.  Praise be!  Hallelujah!  I got the Spirit inside me!  Sorry, sorry...too many Madea movies lately.

After a short wait we were seated by our nice hostess.  I'm thinking she may be one of the owners, her native Chicago accent was present!  A few short minutes later our waitress presented herself and brought us our drinks of water and coffee.  

The menu at The Omelet House is almost typical with lots of other breakfast joints here in Vegas.  Lots and lots of breakfast items, with a mix of burgers, sandwiches, salads, and soups.  I know this place does dinner as well, but I didn't get to go through that menu so we'll just focus on breakfast and lunch.  I really like how this Omelet House has a sprinkling of Chicago in their menu, they have some good looking stuff.  Specialties like Chicago dogs, and Italian beef sandwiches can be had for your meal.  There are a number of omelettes and breakfast specials to choose from, it can be overwhelming.

I stuck with what I like from these breakfast joints, a Club Sandwich.  Yes, a Club Sandwich.  In this case at The Omelet House, a California Club.  Comes with turkey, avocado, lettuce, tomato, and mayo on white or wheat bread.  Also a side of potato spuds (think chips), fries, soup or salad.  I don't know what it is about a Club Sandwich that I like so much.  Might be the nostalgia of when we used to go to restaurants as a kid my Mom would always order a Club Sandwich and share some with me.  Might be that 3rd layer of bread that made a Club Sandwich seem so darn special.

Anyway, the Club Sandwich at The Omelet House was good.  A nice sized portion, big looking sandwich.  The bread was nice and toasted, the veggies were fresh, and the fries were tasty.  Not the best Club Sandwich I've ever had because this one needed more mayo (lots please), and some bacon!  This sandwich would have been off-the-cuff with some crispy bacon!  It was just missing a punch of salt.

The wifey had a corned beef omelet with potato spuds.  Large omelet!  Very tasty too.  The salty corned beef went great with the delicate eggs.  Add some Tabasco and it was some good eats.  But I have had better omelettes elsewhere.  Breakfasts also come with your choice of toast, english muffin, pumpkin nut bread, banana nut bread, or tortillas.  We got the banana nut bread and it was yummy.  Not too dry, lots of bananas!  

It's a tad pricy to eat at The Omelet House I'm guessing because it is Summerlin after all.  Much of the menu ranges from the $7 - $10 area for entree type dishes.  So if you're a cheapy look at the menu accordingly.  Service is fast since you will probably be eating with a million other people.  But they are nice for the most part.  Probably be back here again for a meal, just wouldn't be my top choice.

Omelet House - Summerlin, Las Vegas

Just let me get their customer service out of way first.  The Omelet House has superb customer service.  There's never been a wait, the entire staff is great, and the food is served with the quickness. 

Omelet House has been around for a couple of years now.  They serve breakfast, lunch, and Italian food.  I have yet to try any of their Italian dishes, but I have tried their breakfast and burgers.  Of course, the highlight is their omelets.  The Omelet House has a long list of omelets ranging from your basic cheese to their everything omelet dubbed "The Kitchen Sink".  They have close to 25 different omelets with cool names to them.  Their omelets come with two slices of bread and potato chips.  Honestly, I've never been a huge fan of potato chips with my omelets, but always end up eating them anyway.  Omelet House has an extensive list of other food options.  But let's be real.  This is the Omelet House.  I'm getting omelets. Besides, I was born to eat omelets.  My name is even in the word omelet.  Overall, I'm a fan. I'm just surprised that I haven't dined here more often. 

MY FAVORITES:
-Meat Lover's ($11.99):  Made with at least 6 eggs, a ton of cheese, bacon, ham, sausage, and ground beef.  This is my go-to omelet.  6 eggs is a lot, especially when it's stuffed with a bunch of protein.  Get this if you want to be full.

-Double Yolk Burger ($12.95): I'm not a huge fan of the bun, but love the rest.  This burger is two 1/2 lb. patties of lean Angus beef, bacon, American cheese, Thousand Island dressing, and an egg.  Keep in mind that their burgers are leaner, which to some may mean less taste.  I think it's perfect. 

TIP #1:  They serve Italian food.  I never noticed the Italian food on the menu. 
TIP #2:  Their omelets are made with 6 large eggs.  If this is too big, you can get their half order.  They only take off a $1. So, I recommend that you get a full order.  Best bang for your buck! 
TIP #3:  Their chili with cheese is packed with a lot of cheese.  Not bad. Good if you got chili cravings. 
TIP #4:  Restaurant is a lot larger in the inside than it appears from the outside. 
TIP #5:  Opens at 7:00 AM.  Closes at 7:00 PM.

Happy Easter my hubby and I came for breakfast I had the lobster eggs Benedict best ever.  My husband had the the polish omelet and was very pleased.  Great service and food for a mom and pop place.  Will be coming y.

I have come to this place for many years and through a couple of owners.  This place is a consistent performer when it comes to good food.  Of course, their specialties are omelets, but you can get plenty of other things, including lunch items as well.   The omelet selection has to be close to 20 different types of omelets (maybe more).  I have tried plenty of them but a couple of things I am consistent about getting is the pumpkin bread as my choice of bread that comes with the meal and the "spuds" which are sliced and seasoned potatoes.  Also, although it isn't a typical breakfast item, they have the best fried zucchini ever.  My family usually orders a batch of this as well as an appetizer.

While the place can get busy, we haven't ever had to wait an extraordinary amount of time to be seated and the staff is always very pleasant and nice.

Overall, this is a great place to dine.  We like it.

Not nearly as good as the one on Boulder Hwy. Ordered a simple Bacon and Eggs and the bacon was to salty, the eggs were cold, and the toast was nearly burned. The potatoes were good and the price was great.

One of the few great breakfast joints in town! Killer biscuits and gravy, they taste almost the same as my homemade!!! The seasoned spuds are a cross between potato chips and fries. Then there is the warm banana nut bread with butter. Orgasmic!

If you're an egg eater, they have tons of omelette options. 

To avoid the crowds, go early or expect to wait for a table, but don't let the wait discourage you. Your tastebuds and belly will thank you!!
Everyone is always so amazingly nice here and when I need an omelette fix, this is the perfect place to be
