Excellent food! They offer a wide variety of items that are made with quality items. The staff is very attentive and always smiling! You feel welcome and truly appreciated when dining with them.

This is a good breakfast place, but I found it a little pricey for what was ordered.

The omlets are very generous in size, and you won't leave hungry. The accompanying pastry is very good, and I usually take it home to enjoy later. Potatoes are decent, but for some reason, they don't always arrive hot.

I have had the Kitchen Sink Omlet, and the Mexican Style Omlet. The Kitchen sink was just too big for me, but lived up to its billing. The Mexican Style, was a good breakfast.

Service was very good, and the server was very personable. 

My only complaint was the cost. It was about $40 for a party of two, and that's more like a decent diner out.

My Dad had a appointment  at Shephard Eye center just down the street. Not knowing the area I went on Yelp to find a breakfast place, was very surprised to see Omelet House Summerlin. We had been to the Charleston location many times and never knew about this place. They are located in the back corner of a shopping center. The place was not very busy. They have a lot of booths and the decor is nice and bright. Same menu as other local. Dad got the Pigskin (ham & cheese) I got the Jolly Green Giant (veggie) omelettes. Though it was not on the menu the waitress asked if we wanted the smaller omelettes, we both said yes. They have the flavored creamers for your coffee (big plus) and the service was great. Omelettes were fabulous as always and the homemade potato chips were nice and crispy. We got the banana bread to go. Glad to know about this location. We will be back.
The staff was friendly and the banana nut bread was tasty. If you order an omelet I suggest order it soft. Portions are huge.

Looking at the reviews I don't know if we are talking about the same place.  I thoroughly enjoyed my meal at this place.  Dozens of Omelet's to choose from.  Our server was quick and attentive.  The layout of the place is nothing to be desired, but they left a couple pictures up to let people know they were proud Chicago transplants.

After exploring their vast menu I had the Californian.  They offer spuds or hash browns I decided on the spuds.  When the food came I noticed they did not skimp on portions.  The spuds were great some were crispy which I love, and the omelet was delicious.  I really had a great experience enough so that I will be back.

Great place for breakfast but expect to wait, they were BUSY.

I had the Waffle Special which includes a homemade waffle, two eggs and sausage. The waffle had an almond flavor that I enjoyed and it was cakey, different but I liked it! My husband had the St. Patrick's Day Omelette and he said it was good.

The staff was friendly but we had a weird start w/ our server. We weren't greeted and when he approached the table he just asked what we wanted to eat and once we were done placing our orders, he walks away without anything even a simple "thanks guys, I'll get this in for ya". He came back like he finally took his crazy meds and was a completely different person bc he was nicer and super polite. 

Anyway, food was good and service can be a toss up but we intend to comeback and hopefully not experience the crazy :)
Omelet was huge! I had the "Popeye".  Came with Homemade Banana bread, was amazing! Service was pretty good. There whenever we needed. Would definitely recommend if you like omelets!

Very slow service! We wen here to try it out since we had been to the one by the strip. This locations staff was very unprofessional, very rude. The food took forever to get out, it was not that hot and was not the greatest. We were sitting at the counter and seeing all the food handled with no gloves and no hand washing was also a big turn off. Probably would not recommend this place to anyone.

Husband and I been coming here for a few years now. We always had excellent service. The food has always been delicious. It has big portions as well. The staff is always extremely friendly and on it. I usually get an omelet but have gotten other items in the menu. My favorite is the homemade bread. It's delicious. I highly recommend this place to everyone.

The service was decent, the guy was half asleep I think which I can understand being tired. 

My biggest thing was they up charge for everything and if you substitute its a minimum of a $1 charge. 
I can't eat bread so asked to sensitive for fruit and was a 1.50 charge and said if not it's too bad no free substitutions

Saturday, 7/15/17,,9am.... Table #4.... I didn't catch the waitress name, but my receipt said, "Tiffanee".... Perfect service, my coffee cup was never below 1/2 full.... Food  was ready within 15 minutes,,,, Had #21..the Rio Grande,,, Mexican sausage, onion/cheese....yumyum...
Very big, had to take 1/2 home.....  Simply the BEST place for breakfast.. If you wrote a bad review, & find something wrong here, perhaps you need to stick with the fast food slop  from Burger King, across the street.

First time visit . We went for breakfast since it was close to an appt. @ mt view hospital. 
Very friendly staff . Ordered the spinach mushroom omelette. W hash browns . It was a 1/2 order which was perfect . Buttttt sorry to say the egg mixture was very tough /rubbery. Other than that coffee was good and will try again . It was certainly a very BUZY place . So they have a good following.
They  are open also for dinner which is Italian fare .
I go here every Friday, I wouldn't go anywhere else. This place is so awesome. The eggs Benedict is amazing. It is a great environment with great food.

I came back after a couple of years to get my usual corned beef hash w/ scrambled eggs and hot chocolate.  The dish also comes with just the right amount of potatoes. It was still delicious and this time I had  sampled the banana and pumpkin bread. They were both very tasty especially if you spread a little butter on the warm bread....yum!

went today for breakfast. Was so excited to see we had one in my neck of the woods since eating here last week in Henderson. Staff was friendly. E ordered the egg white omelette and added turkey. I got the pancake special. Food was good. Omelette definitely was not as big as the other location but still good. Pancakes were big but kinda hard to cut w the fork like maybe too much yeast. Will still go back.
Totally cheap, nasty, gross food! Skip this place.

This is a great little gem in the heart of the Sun City Summerlin area.  You can tell its popular with the locals the moment you walk in and it still carries that feel of a diner you remember going to with your parents when you were a kid.  Service is always great and the staff is super friendly.  They've got an extensive menu of pretty much every omelette under the sun, but ironically I can't resist the Eggs Benedict.  Tried multiple dishes here and none fail to impress.   Between the Chile Verde Omelette, to the Nutella French Toast and the Eggs Benedict with lobster it's all gravy, no pun intended.  Omelette House, I salute you.

Excellent breakfast restaurant. They have a large menu with many breakfast options to choose from. We had the egg white omelettes with hash browns, pumpkin bread, and banana bread. The food was very good and the portions were more than enough. The only problem was there was no soy or almond milk for my coffee. I just ran next door to Smiths and bought some almond milk...problem solved.

If you like big-ass omelets, you will like this place. They have a million to choose from. I asked my waitress about a particular omelet, and she told me she didn't eat meat! Anyway, my omelet was good, service was good, and the toast and banana bread and those potatos that looked like chips looked damn good and those at adjoining tables looked happy wolfing down all those carbs! My only real complaint was the coffee. They must buy the cheapest coffee they can find. 

Next time I will save a carb day for this place.
Great location although not exactly the same  as omelette house on charleston . Very friendly servers. I Had the spinach mushroom baby omelette. It was good portion wise. Will try again

Live in the neighborhood and have been here many times. The people who work here are wonderful. Service is always fast and food is tasty. Coffee is very gooI sometimes come here only because the waitresses are so nice. Food is typical, but priced a little better than your avg bfast joint. Disappointed that they won't let me substitute something else besides freakin sliced tomatoes for the bfast potatoes, but oh well. Above average on all accounts.

A great place for omelets!  They have a great selection, even some healthy options. I had the egg white omelet. It was huge and stuffed with spinach and mushrooms. I tried a side of pumpkin bread and it was served warm with a side of butter. So good!
We had great service, and were in and out under an hour.

We love stopping  by for breakfast or lunch. They have a nice variety of menu items for either one. The staff is friendly and the service is quick. This is your basic cafe fare, but they do it very efficiently.

Omelet House in Summerlin is our Go-to place for breakfast & lunch!!  Here they treat you like family.  They have fast WiFi and you can work or check emails while there.
They have a big menu with tons of choices for breakfast, lunch & Italian dinner.  Prices are very reasonable.  Iggy, the owner is always there to take care of his customers.  

Best of all, they serve Gluten Free French Toast!!

Became a "regular" whenever in town visiting my Father. These folks work hard and fast to bring you a delicious big portioned meal. The omelettes are fantastic and the service is superb. Can be busy at time but most good breakfast spots are! Steer away from the haters who dare to give this place a bad review especially the guy who gave the place one star and happens to hate omelettes !! Really Dude?? Pick another spot maybe?? 
The staff :
Stacy, Tiffany, Isabelle,Cassie and Pam are terrific. The owner Iggy (from Chicago) is a great host .
Omelettes 5 Stars ,Banana Bread Five Stars!!

Great breakfast place. Hugh servings and the waitress was fantastic. I called early and said I have 15 or more people coming around 10:30AM. Was told no reservations at that time so I said I would chance it. I arrived and they had a table set up for us, and gave us one waitress who was great. Nothing missed. Food was good (mine was a little cold) but considering they had so many plates coming out at once, it was fine. I could not eat all of my dish it was so big. Had the black forest ham omelet with hash browns and pumpkin bread for my bread. Wow.

Overall the place is pretty good.  Omelets are huge and the food is good.  Service is usually spot on.  It has a bright and friendly atmosphere.  Not sure what these other yelpers are talking about.  Bacon was salty?  Isn't bacon suppose to be naturally salty?
Love this place, spuds are delish and the dinner specials are only at this location.  My favorites are Farmer Juan and Country club omelettes

Overall, an excellent experience! We are vegan, and the waitress was very accommodating, even though the menu says, "no substitutions," at the bottom. Their potatoes are real, not frozen. This place is independently owned, and the owner was there helping out. The whole environment is homey and personal. Highly recommend!

Service is good...that's where the good stops. Huge omelet but over cooked and I asked for onions sauteed did not happen. Coffee luke warm. Heinze jam tasted like shit. The worst potatoes ever. I mean seriously the owner needs to try his own food and be honest. Dont penny pinch on the small stuff it just adds to the miserable experience. 20 bucks with tip..they need to step up their game....maybe they have a following but it wasnt to my taste or quality level. I would rather have a smaller , higher quality meal.

This is a bit overdue and reflects several trips to the Omelet House. The service is good, the omelet selection is huge, and the several I've had are each delicious. I'll continue to frequent this place whenever I'm in the mood for a good breakfast. Be warned that the Sunday brunch crowd can be large. That said, they do a pretty good job of moving people through.

Upon arriving the restaurant was not busy for an early sunday morning. We were the only ones waiting to be seated. We were a party of 6 with 4 being children. I asked to have one highchair. I was seated at a booth then had to remind the waitress after several minutes if I could please have my highchair. The staff didn't seem too friendly but perhaps they are more used to serving the mostly an older crowd and were put off by all my kids. 

As far as the food we ordered the biscuits and gravy with eggs and potatoes. It was not good and worse my breakfast potatoes were green. The waffle and french toast breakfast plates were just ok not worth the price. The only on who enjoyed his food was my son who ordered pancakes with chocolate chips. They are not cooked in like other places they just threw a ton of chips on top so he had a big melted mess of chocolate everywhere. 

I'm pretty sad I did not get the experience everyone else seems to rave about. Normally I give places with really good reviews a second chance in case I came on a bad day. This place I will not being coming back to. If a cook bothers to serve me a potato thats obviously not ripe and green makes me feel like they don't care about the food they serve.

This is one of my go to places for breakfast.  Their omelets are always yummy and I always have enough left over for another meal.  Their banana bread is really good too.  I have been here for dinner and it isn't my favorite, so I just stick to breakfast.  The waitresses are always friendly as well and the service is great even if they are busy.

I've been to this restaurant dozens of times over the past years.  It is family owned and operated.  I've seen one remodel which made the place look much nicer to go along with the very nice people who work there.  The food and service has been consistently very good.  We typically go for breakfast items.  Once in a while we order lunch.  I cannot resist patty melts!  It very much feels like a neighborhood family diner.  It is located in a very busy shopping center so parking may be a struggle at times.
One of the only places to grab breakfast around Summerlin area. One of the best. Great owners, great staff, fabulous food.

This place has a large menu of items to choose from, but just average food. The service isn't the best and not much for kids to choose from either. I don't understand when waiters try to stick it to you either. When I ordered for my kids, he put down all the items as individual side orders instead of as a combo as it is on the menu. He stated that its because the side order is a bigger portion, well geez... I didn't think that was necessary for a 7 year old girl AFTER I just asked him for suggestions on menu items that have SMALLER portions. Then when the bill came, the kids drinks were rang in as adult ones.  I'll stick to other breakfast places in the area. The stars were only given for the wide variety of menu options, not much else positive to say about this place.

Where do I start....in the breakfast restaurant race here in Vegas...this place just above IHOP and that is not a good thing.  The pros the service was extremely friendly and coffee was being filled as soon as you took 2 swallows and....that's pretty much it.
Now on to the food...when we walked in and noticed the place is packed so we figured the food must be amazing....dead wrong 
Well at least what we both had...we both had the pork chops special.  To start you can tell the pork chops was defrosted by microwave it was under seasoned and that's pretty much it again we also had buckwheat pancakes very dry...sorry I know you will always have good clientele being you are next to sun City Summerlin but let's say thier palate is a little aged.   Unfortunately I'm not an omelet fan so I can't say I'll be back to try it...sorry

I guess that I forgot to review this place in the past, but I had relatives visit, and we decided to go  there.
Very, very good.
I have a big appetite and I can get a 6 or 8 egg omelet in this place...Yeah baby!
They have at least 20 different kinds of omelets listed on the menu, but they had no problem mixing and matching various options, which was great for the kids.
My relatives commented on the great service, and I would have to agree.
They frequently asked if we needed re-fills on our drinks, and when I decided to order something last minute, they brought it out more quickly that I had expected.
My relatives also commented on the affordable price, and again, I would have to agree.
I don't see a flaw.
We have been here four or times for breakfast and everyone service and food were excellent . Banana bread is great!!

When I have time and great company I enjoy this true Mom & Pop Establishment. The serving sizes are large and it's quality food! some of the  wait staff are experienced and have stayed loyal to  this location for a while and have great advice for newbie's ..

DO NOT EAT HERE... especially if you have kids. this is the same name, but "not affiliated" with the other Omelet Houses. This store is not run the same, and they are not customer friendly. Everything is an upcharge. 

I refuse to order adult portions, and spend $12 for each of my kids to eat, when they only are going to eat a small amount. NO KIDS menu, no kids drinks. i tried to order from the "specials menu" which also says "kids under 10 anytime" and No special prices on HOLIDAYS. Are you kidding me? 

$7.89 for dry greasy eggs that my daughter didnt finish because they were poor quality.

My family does not eat PORK. Upcharge for turkey sausage, no turkey bacon! We will not ever return to this place ever. Their prices are already high enough, in my opinion, to absorb the cost of a single tiny Jimmy Dean turkey sausage patty. $3.99 for a single patty of turkey sausage... WOW! definitely not customer friendly pricing strategy. 

The server was nice, and friendly, and understanding, but agreed that the place was not kid or customer friendly. Had we not already ordered and received drinks, we would have left without ordering.

They can try to gouge the seniors and folks without kids who may patronize this place, but I can definitely see them going out of business.

Really can't find anything negative to say about this place.  We came looking for the old bagel shop and well being that it's Monday the bakery that is in its place now was closed. Why do restaurants or bakeries or anyplace that wants to make money close on Mondays? I'll never understand!  Anywho....we decided to stop in for a quick bite.

The food was great.  I don't normally order eggs Benedict but I did today because they offer multiple options for this classic breakfast staple.  I opted for the crab cake Benedict while my hubs had the lobster Benedict.  We both enjoyed what we got.  They both came with avocado and you can never go wrong with this "super fruit"!! The house potatoes that were served with our breakfast were homemade and yummy!

The service was great and friendly.  We felt welcomed from the moment we walked in the door to the time we left.  The ambiance in this place is old school diner with lots of family photos.  There is plenty of parking out front.  The meal arrived quickly so we were able to go about our day.
We absolutely love eating here, good food, great service! Ask to be seated in Pam's section. She is the best server we have ever had!
Good food, huge servings. Decent service.

This place needs another "$", IT'S EXPENSIVE!
My wife and I got a club sandwich, iced tea, root beer, and a bowl of chili.  Add 15% and it was over $32.00!
Great people and above average service though.  

LOL the next night we had chicken parm and pasta with meat sauce for four right down the street FOR FOUR PEOPLE for less!

Let me know when you get back from ridiculous with your prices.

This was our second time coming here, and Pam our server with a personality, was quick, efficient, and attentive not to mention the food was delicious.  The Omelette house in Summerlin has a wonderful homey vibe.  We will definitely be back!!

Consistently good.
Good service, friendly staff. Dependable breakfast with many omelet choices. Pumpkin bread is really a treat. My favorites though are the spuds and the bleu burger. It's a homey atmosphere especially for a native Chicagoan.

We came to omlette house while visiting family here in town. Recommended to try this place by some friends. Right off the start we were greeted and sat promptly. Our server was very polite and got us drinks right away. I ordered the Mile High City omelette. Our wait was a little longer than I would have liked but so be it, once our food did arrive it looked and tasted great! Great local spot if your in the area. I would recommend this to friends and family. Cheers

First time for my wife and I and our breakfast was amazing. I had "The Kitchen Sink" and it was all that it could be. There were so many ingredients that you would think it would clash and taste terrible but it was awesome! So many flavors that complimented each other. My wife had "The Mediterranean" which had spinach, mushrooms, mozzarella cheese, and it was loaded with lobster and shrimp! It even came with a side of Hollandaise sauce. She got the other side choice of "Spuds" which was some flat cut potatoes that were crunchy and yummy! Great service, awesome food, and a comfortable atmosphere. We'll be back!
One of my favorite places in town for breakfast!! The omelette are giant and I never leave hungry!! Give it a try!! I need to try dinner someone.

I really wanted to like this place. They would have received 3-3.5 stars ( if such a thing existed) because my omelette was good. Unfortunately, my service was horrible. Our server, Lisa completely ignored our table as I watched her tend to the other tables. 2 parties came in after us and both received drinks before us. Furthermore, when our food finally came she did not refill our drinks. I practically had to do a half jumping jack to get her attention. When it came time to receive the bill, it was another battle for her attention as she stood at the counter talking to one of the other servers. This was my first time here, I sat and ate in anger which was really frustrating. I hoped this would be my regular a few times a week breakfast spot. It won't be, I have a really bad taste in my mouth for this place because of how I was treated.

Staff and service were top notch, owner was very nice.
I had the Eggs Benedict and added a side of banana bread. The Eggs Benedict was delicious, loved their "potato chips", dip those in the Hollandaise....yum!
My husband got the Chili Verde Omelet and they were accommodating and allowed him to add jalapenos to it. It was tasty as well. Our friends enjoyed their breakfast as well. I'm surprised more people don't know about this place. the dining room is large. We went on a Sunday morning about 9:30 and it was half empty but there were plenty of people both coming and going, so they were busy. The crowd was mainly older folks but it's because it's location is so close to Sun City.
I would go back again if given the chance.
Great food! That person before me who recommended the banana bread was right - delicious!

Fantastic non-chain spot for breakfast. Delicious food....very friendly and quick service....pleasant atmosphere--can't ask for much more. incredible menu....I had the #10 omelet..porky pig..filled with sausage and cheddar cheese. very good. Healthy eating wife had a half omelet($1 less than full size)#40 greek feta and spinach. loved it. my son had the #16 meat lovers. licked his platter clean. Make sure you get the little disc home fry potatoes...like eating potato chips. Added extra--each omelet comes with either home made banana nut bread or pumpkin bread. prices may look a little high..but you really get a lot to eat. Our server Cassie was terrific and her assistant Roland was top notch.

Chicago themed neighborhood breakfast spot that caters to local families.  It's tucked in the corner of the Smith's shopping center.  They offer a pretty wide/diverse selection of omelets plus some other breakfast dishes & lunch items.  Despite the name, we noticed that they had dinner menus there too.

We stopped in on a Saturday morning around 10am, and there was a 15 minute wait for a table.  It has a family owned business feel; everything and everybody has a purpose.  There were quite a few families with children who were all well behaved.  Service was no frills and to the point, but it was difficult to get water refills.

Bf was super happy about his omelet, the #20 Polish Omelet that was stuffed with cheddar & polish sausage.  The ham & egg plate was better than it looked.  

The mentality here was one of 'if it ain't broke, don't fix it', so I highly suspect that they will thrive on with the same consistency of service, menu, decor, etc.  Will nothing was bad, nothing was overly memorable as well.

Food is great with huge portions! Price is great! The only reason I did not give them 5 stars is because 

#1 the women's restroom  is not ADA compliant! I could not open the door by myself and had to have my husband help me into the restroom. Once inside I found it extremely difficult to get my wheelchair into the "handicap" stall. I finally made it into the stall and it was so small that I had trouble maneuvering my wheelchair. Getting out of the stall was just as hard as getting in. When I tried to leave the restroom I was unable to open the door and maneuver my wheelchair at the same time. Ended up having to text my husband to help me. 

#2 I understand the staff has to sweep the floors etc to keep the restaurant looking nice. With that said, they do not need to sweep underneath the customers chair and table while they are still eating. 

Was a great brunch!

The Bugsy Siegel omelet is the stuff dreams are made of. Okay maybe just my dreams but still. The tender chunks of italian roast beef and melted mozzarella cheese inside of an omelet are pure heaven to me. The home style potatoes are equally delicious. This location seems less busy than the other and usually has 2 for 1 coupons in the paper. The service is always prompt and friendly.
Eggs Benedict with lobster was great! Service was great, decor was old .. Price was just right fr the food quality

me and my kids walked in at 8:50am, got seated promptly, we got our food less then 10 minutes after we ordered and the place was packed. food was great. great prices, got checked on multiple times. big portions so we had to go boxes to take home. we were out of there by 9:25am. great service !

My main problem is the overfull menu, how can lot of this, not be bought in. The staff were helpful and friendly, the food tasted OK, for a quick breakfast it is OK. I will not be hard but don't expect the best and you will not be disappointed.

My family and I have been going to the Omlet House for several years, however I had an experience that caused me to never return.  My husband, son, and I went to have breakfast one Saturday morning.  We arrived and were seated at approximately 8 am.  I had a meeting and had to leave around 9.  I ordered Eggs Benedict and at 8:45 our food was finally delivered.  The plates were too hot to touch, suggesting the food had sat under the heat lamp for quite some time.  When I cut into my eggs they were hard cooked.  I tried to flag down the waitress, but had to wait about 10 minutes to finally get her attention.  When she finally came over I asked her to please remove it from the bill.  She told me if I ate even one bite she was unable to.  I hadn't eaten even a bite.  The owner came over and gave me a $7 off card for our next visit.  I thanked him but told him I just wanted the meal taken off and didn't need a coupon off our next meal.  It was a simple mistake and unfortunately didn't have time to have the eggs remade.  No harm, no foul.  He insisted I take the coupon.  I had to leave so my husband paid the bill.  Later in the day I looked at the receipt and saw I was charged for the Eggs Benedict after all!  I went back to the restaurant and tried to explain the situation.  The owner came up to the cashier and said he had given me a $7 off coupon.  The improperly prepared food had cost $10.99.  I asked for her to refund the money plus tax.  The owner took $10 out of his pocket and tossed it on the counter and asked for his coupon back and rudely suggested that I order something else IF I come back.  As I turned to leave the cashier said to the owner, loudly enough for me to hear, that she couldn't believe I was making such a big deal over $10 and that if I couldn't afford to go out to eat then I shouldn't go out to eat.  I left this restaurant feeling really horrible.  Twice a month for the past 3 years we have eaten there, we have spent about $40 per meal.  Yet I was treated so poorly when I asked for a wrong to be righted.  I will not return and hope that they treat other customers better than me.

The food was great,  but the wait staff and management were by far the worst I've encountered.  The simple task of splitting the check, was out of their grasp. 4 times and we finally got a bill that was accurate. Unfortunately we had to deal with the attitudes and the idiotic second grade math. Make sure you bring your calculator to double check the math.

Super yummy breakfast spot. Love love LOVE the banana nut bread. I typically order the Jolly Green Giant omelet which is full of awesomeness. Nice atmosphere, quick and friendly service. Definitely beats overpriced places like IHop. At least you get your money's worth here. I recommend all to visit AT LEAST once...and get the banana nut bread!

Omelete House is my morning spot! This is the best neighborhood place for a sit-down breakfast at a reasonable price. This place caters to an older crowd and it's in the corner of a shopping center parking lot, but all this aside, this is a great place to have a big ol' plate of food for about 10 bucks. Have one of the specialty omelets, like a Jolly Green Giant or a Popeye, they're fantastic. If you're not looking for glitz or glam, just good food at a good price, then this is the place for you.

Searching for best pancakes in Vegas. These won't make the top 5. Fluffy but lacking flavor, suspect they use a pre-made mix. Also, the bottom side of the pancake was strangely elastic and difficult  to cut even with a knife. You get what you pay for. This place is very cheap so go for a deal but don't expect high quality ingredients. Lastly, I know it's hot in Vegas but the AC at this location doesn't do the job so the dining area was stuffy and uncomfortable at least when I was there on a weekend morning.

If you are an old white person, you would love it here.

The portions are huge, the waitress's remind me of Flo from the Alice Show. If they said to kiss their grits it would have been perfect.

Totally reminded me of a throwback kind of diner.

Gr8 omelets and Italian food.  Neighborhood breakfast/lunch spot w/decent service.  Food seems sometimes inconsistent.  Can have gr8 baked ziti and then awful chicken picatta.  Nice lunch specials.  The Pilgrim sandwich is my favorite.  Good ambience and business can be conducted.  Go w/smaller omelette.  Family friendly.

Cute mom and pop place .. Have lots of options but the food is just average... We've had the burger and also had breakfast here and it's you basic stuff... No wow factor for the food I think it's great for the older folks that live in sun city

My husband and I have been coming to this location for years and must say it is out of this world!!! Iggy the owner is as welcoming as they come! He makes you feel like you are a family member as well as the rest of the staff! Pam who has been my favorite server and I followed her for years is truly a gem and cannot do a enough for you!!! Their food is amazing and I cannot recommend this place enough I have lived in Vegas for over 20 years and it is definitely one of my favorite breakfast joints!!! You will not be disappointed I can promise!!!

Nope, nope, nope.  Staff was friendly enough but we didn't much care for the food or the ambience. The restaurant was a bit cold with the day that we went to eat there, which in turn made our food cold before we could even get halfway through it.

Great breakfast place the chorizo omelet is my favorite so far. Huge portions and unbelievably cheap price for what your getting. The pumpkin bread is great also. Nothing is better then the fried zucchini as an appetizer it's crazy good a must try.

I"m giving this place 3 stars based solely on my breakfast of Eggs Benedict. I liked the atmosphere, the wait staff was great and friendly. Unfortunately the Eggs Benedict wasn't that good, the hollandaise sauce was severely lacking any flavor. 
Prices seem reasonable, maybe a touch high for certain items.

I wanted to try this place because the real one was good and this one is closer to my home. But I really don't think I will ever visit it again the employees seemed really stand off to their guests or at least how I felt we sat at the counter and there is an employee I guess an manager or whomever he was he was taking the orders from when they were ready and putting them on this try and then would notify the servers of their orders ready. Then when this guy came next to us he grabbed his order and drink then when my parties order came up he sat the plates on the tray and then walked away and told another person to give us our food. While he helped this other guy who no questions. Felt like favoritism was in play here. The food was alright not as good at the other location. But I didn't really feel welcome and comfortable there and at the time to tell anyone about it seemed they wouldn't have cared also. I will not be going back to this location again. I will make the drive to the main location where I felt welcomed and happy there. Sorry for those who really like this place.
Awesome place to eat..Food was very good they give big portions staff is very friendly.will be back

I have been enjoying eating at the Omelette House for years. Great staff and family owned. You will often times find the owner and his family helping out and talking to the guests and generally making sure everything runs smoothly. If you leave hungry you have done something wrong because the omelet's are of epic proportions. I highly recommend the Rio Grande Surfer scrambled with some avocado and sour cream. Or the Lox omelette and throw in some onions. Spuds or hash browns, well you'll have to decide. The banana nut bread is always good instead of toast or the pumpkin bread if you must. This place gets busy so plan accordingly, and the reason it's busy is because the food is good and there is plenty of it and the staff is excellent and always attentive. They always work hard to take care of me and anyone I've ever brought so, kudos to the Omelette House. See you next time.

This place is the best!  Great service and consistently wonder food.  Family owned and operated and done with care and love.  If you what a good meal at a decent price this is your place.  I've never had a bad meal here and we eat here 3-4 times a week.  The Minestrone soup is the best you will ever find!

This place is very hit or miss. I hate giving lousy ratings to a place like this because I know there are many loyal retirees that live nearby and make this place their 2nd home. And that, by itself, is a cool thing. But, after today's breakfast, I need to leave a review.  Breakfast today was one of the worse I've eaten in a very long time. The famous "corned beef hash" tasted sour and luke warm in temp and like it was reheated. The hash browns looked and tasted as if it were from a frozen box. The toast was stale. The only thing that tasted decent were the 2 eggs!  Not to mention that my CBH and eggs and coffee totaled more than $13!! Ridiculous. 2 McD sausage mcmuffins with egg for $3.33 and a $1 coffee would have hit the spot much better.

Service is also spotty. Sometimes you get one of the more vibrant smiling wait staff, and other times you're not so lucky. You get a disenchanted bus-boy type person.
I've been eating here for 2 years now, and I think it's about time I wrote about it. 
Better for breakfast connoisseur's to try a place like BabyStacks on Buffalo or Jamm's on Rainbow in my opinion. Is it that hard to make a good breakfast, Las Vegas? Come on....don't just settle because they're close to home.

Omg. So good.  
Pam, my waitress is super sweet and cute.  Love her.  Awesome service. 

Environment - 5
Cute, homey, sweet, clean
Service - 5
Pam is the diamond of service industry 
Food - 5
So good.  I had the chili Verde omelet.  Wow.  Best chili Verde ever.  My friend had corn beef and he said it's the best corn beef he ever has. 
Overall - 5
5s

This is a MUST try if you are around Summerlin.

Well I'll say this, food is good but service is not their strong suit. 

Waitress came by only once and luckily I knew what I wanted right away otherwise I would've kept waiting for who knows how long! She literally kept staring at me every time she walked by like she was purposely avoiding me! 

Waited 25 mins waiting on my check. Although I wanted to order more food I didn't see that happening. It's a bit of a drive but I'd say go to the location in Henderson, much better service!

Family and I ate dinner here July 7th. Stacy was our server. We placed our order. A portion of the order was returned to us wrong. Stacy apologized, blamed the cook and offered to re-make my Mom's order. When the bill came we noticed it had charges on it that didn't make sense. We asked Stacy to clarify. She seemed to get irritated with our questions. The situation got heated. When we saw the revised bill Stacy had written FUCKING ASSHOLE BLACK PEOPLE JUSTBEING THEMSELVES. She didn't intend for us to see that copy. She didn't deny she wrote it, and repeatedly said I'M SORRY I'M SORRY. I called the owner while still in the restaurant and explained the situation. He apologized, requested we return so he could " take care " of us. Later I spoke to him and he said Stacy would be SUSPENDED. In the next conversation he said she'd be FIRED.

Eggs are the best and in my view under rated food. This little joint is in the strip mall by Smiths on Lake Mead & Rampart. I ran in there for lunch on a weekday. I was seated at the counter and ordered an omelet with ham, mushrooms and Swiss. It was enormous and served with home made chips, coffee and toast. Simply delicious. 

The restaurant is near Sun City so it is frequented by a mainly older crowd but I did see a few 'youngsters' , including a girls with a bunch of carrots tattooed on her leg! Most original!

Chicago sports fan rejoice! Having moved to Vegas 2 years ago and being a Cubs fan I find its hard to get comfortable as most restaurants and bars try to stay as neutral as possible so as not to offend customers from competing cities.

The Omelet House doesnt care about that nonsense. They are proud to be from Chicago and dont  try to hide it. All of their decor is Chicago based and I was in heaven.

Ok so how was the food? It was awesome! There was two of us and we split three dishes. The daughter had eggs Benedict and I had the loch ness. We split the waffle plate. The daughter said the Benedict was delicious and loved the waffle. 

My loch ness was pretty good but kinda gross at the same time.  I love seafood and I love eggs/breakfast dishes but have never tried to put the two together? Had to give it a try. 

The Shrimp was fresh but the shrimp flavor didnt mix well with the eggs and the avocado didnt help blend the flavors together. My suggestion for it would be to add a creamy white sauce to help blend the three contrasting flavors together.

The wait staff was top notch always willing to make a suggestion and refill your drink. Jen was our server and she was awesome and knew the dishes well enough to answer the many questions I had as well as to make suggestions bases on my questions.

The spiced pumpkin bread is amazing as well. I just cant seem to say enough nice things about this place but yes it is amazing and this humble Yelper highly recommends it.

They had a second chance to make a good impression and succeeded. 

My husband and I go brunching on Sundays. We decided to go to this location at random. The first thing we noticed is that the greetings we got weren't as friendly as the Charleston location. Our waitress seemed a bit off, hard to describe. Standoffish? Snooty? Something along those lines. We felt uncomfortable. 

The food was good, served fairly quickly. We had Porky and Petunia omelettes, he tried biscuits and gravy for the first time. They were so good that now it's a regular thing for him to ask for. The biscuits were fresh, an abundance of gravy. 

We went to the gas station across the street afterwards. My husband realized that he had dropped a $100 bill in the now closed restaurant. I called and the owner answered, asked his staff if anyone had seen it...they did not. My husband shrugged and said that he expected that to have happened at the other one, not in Summerlin, and went into the store. My cell rang, someone had found the money! We were so surprised and relieved. 

We have a ton of other places to brunch, but this Omelette House earned a spot on our 'return' list.

Meh. I went here for lunch. Service was okay; I've had much better at most places. They seem to cater to an older demographic. I noticed that older folks and apparent regulars got very friendly service. Not me.

Food was so-so. Eggs and toast were fine. Bacon was not good. The "spuds" were interesting - I just wish there wasn't pepper dumped on a few of them (making them practically inedible). The coffee was horrible. I was never asked if I wanted a refill, not that I really wanted one. I would go here in a pinch since the prices were fair, but definitely not somewhere I would crave.
One of the better breakfast holes in Summerlin.  I got the Lobster Benedict.  Legit.  Decent size place, good prices.  Above average for food sure.  Waitress was good even though place was packed.
Haven't been here for awhile   The corned beef hash and home cut potatoes are still great. The service is always friendly.

Mmmmgood.. we love coming to the Omelet House for breakfast!! Service is great and the food is always good.  Owners Chef Iggy and Annamaria treat us like family and the staff do as well!  My 2 favorite omelettes are THE GREEK AND THE POPEYE (delicious) and we will be going back to have some Italian for dinner soon!!!

Not terrible, but they used canned spinach for their Benedict Florentine, and it wasn't worth finishing. The fried potatoes were good, and the service was great. I'll come back, but next time I'll have an omelet.
